title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 02 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
00:09 <evandroNogueiraE> has left #xwiki  
00:40 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:40 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki

00:50 <tillo> has joined #xwiki

06:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:55 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
12:43 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <mflorea> has quit  
13:34 <tdelafosse> has quit  
13:42 <tmortagne> guys could I get some comments on "[PROPOSAL] Add support for the reference locale in XWiki#getDocument/exist"  
13:44 <vmassol> checking  
13:46 <vmassol> repllied  
13:46 <vmassol> \*replied  
14:13 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <mflorea> guys, re http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9259 I'm wondering if I should replace "Language" with "Locale" in the search UI. If I'm going to use the "locales" Solr filter behind the scenes, then the user will get a "Locale" facet when searching for all languages, thus there will be an inconsistency with the "Language" from the advanced options. I could display the face name as "Language" but I'm not what's best.  
15:06 <mflorea> tmortagne, vmassol: wdyt?  
15:07 <tmortagne> we need to choose one that's for sure  
15:07 <mflorea> Locale is more technical than Language  
15:08 <tmortagne> but that's a question for native English speaker if it's OK to call language "fr\_FR"  
15:08 <mflorea> but using Language when in fact it's a locale is not that good either  
15:08 <tmortagne> from Java point of view language is just the "fr" part  
15:08 <tmortagne> but I agree Locale that you don't see Locale a lot in UIs  
15:09 <tmortagne> s/agree Locale/agree/  
15:09 <mflorea> another thing is that I get the list of languages to display in the Language filter from XWikiPreferences, and in the administration the list is called "Supported Languages"  
15:09 <mflorea> I guess I'll display Language for now, and use locale behind the schenes  
15:10 <tmortagne> all old stuff are called languages basically  
15:11 <mflorea> yep  
15:11 <tmortagne> now I don't know if there is any alternative in "basic user vocabulary"  
15:12 <vmassol> Locale is too tech  
15:12 <vmassol> Language is much better from a user pov  
15:13 <mflorea> true  
15:13 <vmassol> If you need to represent fr\_FR it should be 2 fields for a user: Country and Language  
15:13 <tmortagne> not easy to represent as the name of a list of choices  
15:14 <mflorea> I'm not going that far right now. I was just wondering about the "Language" advanced filter  
15:14 <vmassol> ok  
15:14 <mflorea> and the "Locale" facet name  
15:14 <mflorea> display name  
15:18 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <sburjan> guys, re SOLR indexing speed, HSQLDB should be the fastest, right ?  
15:21 <tmortagne> not so sure  
15:21 <tmortagne> it's all in memory but that does not mean it has to be the best just because of that  
15:23 <sburjan> because I am still experiencing slowness ... 10 minutes for 5000 entries. but msmeria is not able to reproduce, so this one is clearly a problem with my computer  
15:23 <sburjan> it's much faster than before. but still slow on my machine :)  
15:31 <tmortagne> sburjan: did you tried to change the configuration ?  
15:32 <sburjan> puttin larger number is faster, yes  
15:32 <sburjan> but it defeats the purpose if the default values don't work for me  
15:32 <sburjan> my idea is to test with the out of the box config  
15:33 <tmortagne> sburjan: this is just configuration, it can't work perfectly for everyone  
15:33 <sburjan> I am investigating further. gonna try with an jetty +hsqldb XE  
15:33 <tmortagne> when you have a lot of memory you use a bigger batch, if you don't have a lot of memory you use a smaller one etc  
15:33 <sburjan> I am angry because I can't narrow down the issue  
15:33 <tmortagne> there is no such thing as perfect default here  
15:33 <sburjan> I have an 8 GB RAM + QUad Core CPU  
15:33 <sburjan> it shouldn't be slow at all  
15:34 <tmortagne> unless you drive is slow because you have other things using it  
15:35 <tmortagne> keep in mind that only one thing can use a drive at once, you have have the most powerful computer that it would still be slow if you have several things writing at the same time on your disk  
15:36 <sburjan> yes, this is why I am blaiming my HDD> I have mysql + postgres running as daemons, but those shouldn't use HDD unless I use the db  
15:37 <tmortagne> sburjan: I don't think you really have to worry for 10 minutes  
15:38 <sburjan> on msmeria laptop finishes in 1 minute, and he has even a lower config than me  
15:38 <sburjan> \*msmeria's  
16:38 <Denis> has quit

18:21 <kstuart> has quit  
18:22 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
18:33 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:40 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:00 <kstuart> has quit  
19:08 <Slashman> has quit  
19:16 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
19:30 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
19:32 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
19:36 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
19:44 <evalica> has quit  
19:49 <jbwiv> guys, I may have screwed up. I was deleting a wiki space and somehow I think it deleted my main space. I restored its main page, but now I get things like "Unknown macro: spaces" and "Unknown macro: activity". Is there any way to recover?  
19:53 <tdelafosse> has quit  
19:56 <vmassol> jbwiv: yes Main.Spaces and Main.Activity  
19:56 <vmassol> you need to restore those 2 pages  
19:56 <jbwiv> vmassol: so http://mywikihost/xwiki/bin/view/Main.Spaces  
19:56 <jbwiv> ?  
19:57 <vmassol> Main/Spaces  
19:57 <vmassol> you can go in the trash  
19:57 <vmassol> and restore pages  
19:57 <jbwiv> ok, I was able to restore them  
19:57 <vmassol> wait  
19:57 <jbwiv> woops  
19:57 <vmassol> I can give you a script  
19:57 <jbwiv> ;)  
19:57 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Restore+Documents  
19:58 <vmassol> depends if you have lots of docs deleted or not  
19:58 <vmassol> if not then go to the trash and undelete  
19:58 <jbwiv> vmassol: I saw that, but it seems to assume you want to type in the pages of all documents  
19:58 <vmassol> it's a snippet  
19:58 <vmassol> you need to adapt it to your needs  
19:58 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
19:58 <vmassol> anyway ATM go to the trash  
19:59 <vmassol> and check how many docs from the main space are in there  
19:59 <jbwiv> vmassol: how do I get to trash?  
19:59 <jbwiv> (sorry, still learning)  
19:59 <vmassol> Wiki > Document Index  
20:00 <vmassol> example: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs?view=deletedDocs  
20:00 <jbwiv> vmassol: that's the weird thing. Document Index is no longer a menu item available  
20:00 <vmassol> ah you need to restore Main.AllDocs :)  
20:00 <vmassol> and the other pages it uses  
20:00 <vmassol> fun  
20:00 <vmassol> :)  
20:00 <vmassol> you removed it  
20:00 <jbwiv> sheesh  
20:00 <vmassol> here:  
20:00 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Deleted+Documents  
20:01 <jbwiv> I actually was trying to delete a space that was created with a " in the name  
20:01 <jbwiv> and it somehow deleted all this other stuff  
20:01 <vmassol> yes you deleted the wrong space  
20:01 <vmassol> it's easy to make the mistake  
20:02 <jbwiv> ok  
20:02 <jbwiv> so just go in and restore all those which have Main in them  
20:02 <jbwiv> cool  
20:03 <jbwiv> vmassol: should it be simple as that ^ ?  
20:03 <vmassol> yes  
20:03 <jbwiv> vmassol: awesome. thanks!  
20:04 <jbwiv> all this to try to get our mediawiki content converted to xwiki :(  
20:05 <vmassol> yeah sorry about that  
20:05 <jbwiv> vmassol: no need to apologize ;)  
20:05 <vmassol> I have already created a jira issue to prevent this kind of mistake but we haven't implemented it yet  
20:05 <vmassol> it happened to me too  
20:05 <jbwiv> I'm really impressed by xwiki's powers so far  
20:05 <jbwiv> love the built in scripting  
20:05 <vmassol> cool  
20:05 <jbwiv> hope once we get to actually contributing the underlying code isn't too bad  
20:06 <jbwiv> that's the one thing about php,python,etc based wikis  
20:06 <jbwiv> you can easily pry open the source and see what's going on  
20:06 <vmassol> it sholuldn't be  
20:06 <vmassol> :)  
20:06 <vmassol> we're here to help too  
20:06 <vmassol> gtg  
20:06 <vmassol> bbl  
20:06 <jbwiv> thanks. take care  
21:02 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
21:08 <Denis1> has quit  
21:09 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
21:18 <jbwiv> has anyone here migrated from mediawiki to xwiki before?  
21:18 <Denis1> has quit  
21:33 <jbwiv> anyone here work on the MediaWiki2XWikiConverter project? I have a few questions about the source if you did  
22:16 <vmassol> has quit  
23:21 <kstuart> has quit  
23:53 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
23:58 <abusenius> has quit
